intro: Hieracium lachenalii subsp. euirriguum, commonly known as the European spear-thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and spiny leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides. Due to its ornamental and ecological value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
